com.mobius.vdrapi.callbacks
Interface IHasFullLoginCredentials

public interface IHasFullLoginCredentials

A class implements IHasFullLoginCredentials to indicate that it can provide login credentials, security, and ticket information, if necessary.

Some document servers may require users to provide their own login credentials, security and ticket information before allowing the connection. Other objects, which use IDocumentServer objects to connect to a document server, may call back to this interface to get login and security information.

See Also:
IDocumentServer, INeedFullLoginCredentials

Method Summary
 void getFullLoginCredentials(String documentServerName, LoginSecurityInfo loginSecurityInfo)
          Obtains login, security, and ticket information for the document server.

Method Detail

getFullLoginCredentials

public void getFullLoginCredentials(String documentServerName,
                                    LoginSecurityInfo loginSecurityInfo)
                             throws UserAbortException
Obtains login, security, and ticket information for the document server.

Parameters:
documentServerName - name of the document server that requires login credentials to be supplied.
loginSecurityInfo - object that contains the user ID, password, recipient ID, security information, type, session ticket information, and the assigned recipient ID.
Throws:
UserAbortException - thrown if the user does not wish to provide login credentials and security information at this time.

setSessionTicket

public void setSessionTicket(byte[] sessionTicket)
Called by an object that implements the INeedFullLoginCredentials interface. When using single sign-on, a command object implementing INeedFullLoginCredentials calls this method to set the session ticket.

useSingleSignon

public boolean useSingleSignon()
Called by an object that implements the INeedFullLoginCredentials interface. If this method returns TRUE, the setSessionTicket method is then called. A class that implements this interface should save the ticket details returned for subsequent logins.
